cache.size.label: Cache size:
cache.size.description: Number of URLs fetched and extracted from before saving results (0=infinite).

reextract.label: Re-extract data
reextract.description: Re-extract data from already processed URLs.

result.table.label: Result table:
result.table.description: Table name to save extracted data to.

retries.label: Connection retries:
retries.description: Number of re-tries on connection errors (-1=infinite).

retry.http.description: HTTP errors that will be handled like connection errors.

sleep.error.description: Sleeping time (in ms) on connection errors.

sleep.http.description: Time (in ms) that will be waited between HTTP requests.

sleep.idle.description: Time (in ms) to wait before checking for new URLs when all URLs have been processed.

sleep.mysql.description: Time (in s) to wait before last try to re-connect to mySQL server.

alias.label: Variable aliases:
alias.description: Alias for the variable with same array index.

alias.add.label: Increase alias value by:
alias.add.description: Value to add to the variable alias with the same array index.

datetime.format.label: Date/time formats:
datetime.format.description:
The date and time format to be used for the variable with the same array index (default: %F %T)
(see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

name.label: Variable names:
name.description: Variable names to be replaced in 'source.url' and 'source.cookies'.

parsed.column.label: Parsed column:
parsed.column.description: Parsed 'id', 'datetime' or field for the variable with the same array index (if parsed data is the source).

parsed.table.label: Parsing table:
parsed.table.description: Name of the table containing the parsed data for the variable with the same array index (if parsed data is the source).

query.label: Variable queries:
query.description: Query on content or URL for the variable with the same array index.

source.label: Variable sources:
source.description: Source of the variable with the same array index.

tokens.label: Token variables:
tokens.description: List of token variables to be replaced in 'source.url' and 'source.cookies'.

tokens.query.label: Token queries:
tokens.query.description: Query to extract token variable with the same array index.

tokens.source.label: Token sources:
tokens.source.description: Source URL for the token with the same array index (absolute link without protocol).

tokens.use.post.label: Use POST for tokens:
tokens.use.post.description: Use HTTP POST instead of GET for the token with the same array index.

alias.add.label: Increase alias value by:
alias.add.description: Value to add to the alias of the paging variable.

first.string.label: First page (string):
first.string.description: Name of the first page (will overwrite its number).

is.next.from.label: Does next page exists?
is.next.from.description: Boolean query on page content to determine whether there is another page.

next.from.label: Get next page:
next.from.description: Query on page content to find the number or the name of the next page (will overwrite step).

number.from.label: Get number of pages:
number.from.description: Query on first page to determine the total number of pages (will overwrite 'is.next.from').

step.label: Paging step:
step.description: Number to add to page variable for getting the next page (if page number is used).

variable.label: Paging variable:
variable.description: Paging variable to be used in 'source.url' and 'source.cookies'. Will be overwritten with either page number or page name.

url.first.label: URL (first page):
url.first.description: URL of the first page to get data from (will be ignored if empty).

datetime.formats.label: Date/time formats:
datetime.formats.description:
The date and time formats to be parsed (default: %F %T)
(see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

datetime.locales.label: Date/time locales:
datetime.locales.description:
Locales used for parsing the date and time
(e.g. 'en_US.UTF8', see C++ 'std::locale' documentary for details).

datetime.queries.label: Date/time queries:
datetime.queries.description: Queries used for parsing the date and time. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used.

field.names.label: Field names:
field.names.description: The names of the custom fields to parse.

field.queries.label: Field queries:
field.queries.description: The queries used to parse the custom fields.

field.tidy.texts.label: Field results as tidied texts:
field.tidy.texts.description: Remove line breaks and unnecessary spaces.

field.warnings.empty.description: Log warning when field is empty.

id.queries.label: ID queries:
id.queries.description: Queries to parse the ID. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used. Pages with duplicate or empty IDs will not be parsed.

error.if.larger.description: Cause fatal error when number of expected datasets is exceeded.

error.if.smaller.description: Cause fatal error when number of expected datasets is exceeded.

parsed.column.label: Parsed column:
parsed.column.description: Parsed 'id', 'datetime' or field containing the expected number of datasets (if parsed data is the source).

parsed.table.label: Parsing table:
parsed.table.description: Name of the result table containing the expected number of datasets (if parsed data is the source).

query.label: Query for number of URLs:
query.description: Query to be performed on content to get the expected number of datasets.

source.label: Source:
source.description: Source of the expected number of datasets.
